p: By far, the researchers have successfully integrated the nano- or microgels and biologics to demonstrate a broad range of applications. Nano- or microgels are integrated with therapeutics to treat diabetes and cancer (Das et al., 2006; Sung et al., 2012; Gu et al., 2013; Kanamala et al., 2016), or assembled with stem cells in the tissue engineering (Das et al., 2014; Caldwell et al., 2017). Recently, the integration of nano- or microgels with engineered cells has proven their superiority in diseases detection and treatment (Shao et al., 2017; Xue et al., 2017; Wang et al., 2018). We will start from the basic characteristics, crosslinking strategies, and synthesis scheme of several nano- or microgels systems, and later discuss their applications when integrated with various biologics. In particular, we will focus on the functional dynamics inside the bio-hybrid systems, from either materials or cells side.
